line_1: Tho' they are chast and honest, yet it doth
line_2: Pursue them, and some company on oath

line_1: Hard and uneasy ev'ry turn she does:
line_2: Poor Mary sighs beneath a load of woes,
Had struggl'd with the Marriage Noose;

line_1: Though hope, on flutt'ring pinions does
line_2: Too hard the task, my humble muse

line_1: Wild and despairing knows not what she does,
line_2: Vertue, forgive the Thought! The raving Muse

line_1: Graceful and useful all she does,
line_2: Blessing and blest where're she goes,

line_1: I wonder how your next door neighbour does;
line_2: I vow next time I deal I'll make a fuz.
